data.enText: arrangement
the way in which people or things are placed or arranged in relation to each other

data.chText: 姓名是按字母顺序排列的。
data.enText: The names are listed in alphabetical order .
in chronological/numerical order

data.chText: 按优先次序 / 重要性 / 大小排列
data.enText: arranged in order of priority/importance/size

data.chText: 结果按递降 / 递升的顺序排列如下：
data.enText: The results, ranked in descending/ascending order are as follows:

data.chText: 一切手续必须按正确顺序办理。
data.enText: All the procedures must be done in the correct order.

data.chText: 咱们换一个顺序来处理这些问题吧。
data.enText: Let's take the problems in a different order.
the state of being carefully and neatly arranged

data.chText: 她到了该好好安排自己生活的时候了。
data.enText: It was time she put her life in order .
The house had been kept in good order.

data.chText: 落笔之前，先要理清思路。
data.enText: Get your ideas into some sort of order before beginning to write.

data.chText: 艺术的功能之一就是在于呈现纷乱中的和谐。
data.enText: It is one of the functions of art to bring order out of chaos.
controlled state
the state that exists when people obey laws, rules or authority

data.chText: 军队被调进首都维持治安。
data.enText: The army has been sent in to maintain order in the capital.

data.chText: 有些教师觉得难以维持课堂秩序。
data.enText: Some teachers find it difficult to keep their classes in order .

data.chText: 警察正在努力恢复公共秩序。
data.enText: The police are trying to restore public order.

data.chText: 争论持续不休，直到主席要求双方遵守议事规则。
data.enText: The argument continued until the chairman called them both to order (= ordered them to obey the formal rules of the meeting) .
instructions
something that sb is told to do by sb in authority
He gave orders for the work to be started.
The general gave the order to advance.

data.chText: 狗可以训练得听从命令。
data.enText: Dogs can be trained to obey orders .
She takes orders only from the president.

data.chText: 我奉命不准任何人进入。
data.enText: I'm under orders not to let anyone in.
No sugar for me─ doctor's orders .

data.chText: 利率可由中央银行指示控制。
data.enText: Interest rates can be controlled by order of the central bank.
goods
a request to make or supply goods
I would like to place an order for ten copies of this book.
an order form

data.chText: 机器零件尚在订购之中。
data.enText: The machine parts are still on order (= they have been ordered but have not yet been received) .
These items can be made to order (= produced especially for a particular customer) .

data.chText: 所订的货物；交付的订货
data.enText: goods supplied in response to a particular order that sb has placed
The stationery order has arrived.
food/drinks
a request for food or drinks in a restaurant, bar etc.; the food or drinks that you ask for
May I take your order ?

data.chText: 本店（打烊前）最后一次点酒了！
data.enText: Last orders at the bar now please! (= because the bar is going to close)
an order for steak and fries

data.chText: 配菜（主菜以外的蔬菜、色拉等）
data.enText: a side order (= for example, vegetables or salad that you eat with your main dish)
money

data.chText: 付款指令（或委托书）；书面指令
data.enText: a formal written instruction for sb to be paid money or to do sth
system
the way that a society, the world, etc. is arranged, with its system of rules and customs

data.chText: 政治和社会结构的改变
data.enText: a change in the political and social order
the natural order of things

data.chText: 他被视为现存制度的大敌。
data.enText: He was seen as a threat to the established order .

data.chText: 新的秩序似乎正在显现。
data.enText: A new order seems to be emerging.
social class
or
a social class
the lower orders
biology
a group into which animals, plants, etc. that have similar characteristics are divided, smaller than a class and larger than a family
the order of primates
religious community

data.chText: （按照一定的规范生活的）宗教团体；（尤指）修会

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的可数名词

data.enText: a group of people living in a religious community, especially monks or nuns
religious orders
the Benedictine order
special honour

data.chText: （获国王、女王、总统等）授勋的人；勋位；勋爵士团

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的可数名词

data.enText: a group of people who have been given a special honour by a queen, king, president, etc.

data.chText: 嘉德勋位是古老的骑士勋位。
data.enText: The Order of the Garter is an ancient order of chivalry.
a badge or ribbon worn by members of an order who have been given a special honour
secret society

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的可数名词

data.enText: a secret society whose members meet for special ceremonies
the Ancient Order of Druids
be in/take (holy) orders

data.chText: 已领受 / 领受神品（或圣秩）；为 / 成为神职人员
data.enText: to be/become a priest
in order
that can be used because it is all correct and legal

data.chText: 你的工作许可证有效吗？
data.enText: Is your work permit in order?
as it should be
Is everything in order, sir?
if sth is in order , it is a suitable thing to do or say on a particular occasion

data.chText: 我想可以喝杯饮料了吧。
data.enText: I think a drink would be in order.
in order (to do sth)
allowed according to the rules of a meeting, etc.

data.chText: 依规定现在可以发言了吗？
data.enText: Is it in order to speak now?
in order that
so that sth can happen

data.chText: 一切有关人员必须通力合作，以便能在这个问题上达成协议。
data.enText: All those concerned must work together in order that agreement can be reached on this issue.
in order to do sth
with the purpose or intention of doing or achieving sth

data.chText: 她早早到场，好找个好位置。
data.enText: She arrived early in order to get a good seat.

data.chText: 为掌握全面情况，还需要详细资料。
data.enText: In order to get a complete picture, further information is needed.
in running/working order
working well

data.chText: 发动机现在运转完全正常。
data.enText: The engine is now in perfect working order.
of a high order
of the highest/first order

data.chText: 高质量的；高品质的；一流的
data.enText: of a high quality or degree; of the highest quality or greatest degree

data.chText: 这项工作要求高超的外交技巧。
data.enText: The job requires diplomatic skills of a high order.

data.chText: 她是天字第一号势利鬼。
data.enText: She was a snob of the first order.
of/in the order of sth
on the order of
about sth; approximately sth

data.chText: 她的年收入为8万英镑左右。
data.enText: She earns something in the order of £80 000 a year.
the order of the day
common, popular or suitable at a particular time or for a particular occasion

data.chText: 悲观失望似乎是当今司空见惯的情形。
data.enText: Pessimism seems to be the order of the day.
Order! Order!

data.chText: （用于提醒人们遵守会议、辩论的规则）安静！安静！；别吵！别吵！
data.enText: used to remind people to obey the rules of a formal meeting or debate
out of order
not working correctly
The phone is out of order.
not arranged correctly or neatly

data.chText: 我检查过案卷，其中有些未按顺序编排。
data.enText: I checked the files and some of the papers were out of order.
out of line

data.chText: 行为不当；举止令人难以接受
data.enText: behaving in a way that is not acceptable or right

data.chText: 你不问一声就把它拿走，这是很不妥当的。
data.enText: You were well out of order taking it without asking.

data.chText: 违反规程的；不合乎（会议或辩论）规则的
data.enText: not allowed by the rules of a formal meeting or debate

data.chText: 他的反对被裁定为违反会议规则。
data.enText: His objection was ruled out of order.
call sb/sth to order

data.chText: 要求安静下来（以便开始或继续会议）；要求遵守会议秩序
data.enText: to ask people in a meeting to be quiet so that the meeting can start or continue
put/set your (own) house in order

data.chText: 先管好自己的事；律人先律己
data.enText: to organize your own business or improve your own behaviour before you try to criticize sb else
law and order
a situation in which people obey the law and behave in a peaceful way
The government struggled to maintain law and order.

data.chText: 暴乱以后，军队出动来恢复治安。
data.enText: After the riots, the military was brought in to restore law and order.

data.chText: 他们声称自己是重视治安问题的政党。
data.enText: They claim to be the party of law and order.
get your marching orders
to be ordered to leave a place, a job, etc.
a/the pecking order
the order of importance in relation to one another among the members of a group

data.chText: 新西兰在橄榄球国家中首屈一指。
data.enText: New Zealand is at the top of the pecking order of rugby nations.
in short order
quickly and without trouble
under starter's orders
waiting for a signal to start the race
be a tall order
to be very difficult to do
give instructions
to use your position of authority to tell sb to do sth or say that sth must happen

data.chText: 公司被勒令向以前的员工作出补偿。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The company was ordered to pay compensation to its former employees.
The officer ordered them to fire.

data.chText: 他们因斗殴被勒令退出课堂。
data.enText: They were ordered out of the class for fighting.

data.chText: 政府要求对事故进行调查。
data.enText: The government has ordered an investigation into the accident.

data.chText: 他们要求每砍伐一棵树就要补栽两棵树。
data.enText: They ordered that for every tree cut down two more be planted.

data.chText: 他们要求每砍伐一棵树就要补栽两棵树。
data.enText: They ordered that for every tree cut down two more should be planted.
‘Sit down and be quiet,’ she ordered.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+直接引语

data.enText: goods/service

data.chText: 订购；订货；要求提供服务
data.enText: to ask for goods to be made or supplied; to ask for a service to be provided

data.chText: 这些靴子可向厂方直接订货。
data.enText: These boots can be ordered direct from the manufacturer.

data.chText: 要我给你叫辆出租车吗？

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: Shall I order you a taxi?

data.chText: 要我给你叫辆出租车吗？
data.enText: Shall I order a taxi for you?
food/drink
to ask for sth to eat or drink in a restaurant, bar, etc.

data.chText: 我要了一杯啤酒，一个三明治。
data.enText: I ordered a beer and a sandwich.

data.chText: 他为自己点了一杯双份威士忌。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: He ordered himself a double whisky.
Have you ordered yet?
organize/arrange
to organize or arrange sth

data.chText: 我需要时间梳理一下思路。
data.enText: I need time to order my thoughts.
just what the doctor ordered
exactly what sb wants or needs
order sb about/around
to keep telling sb what to do in a way that is annoying or unpleasant

data.chText: 以上各词均含命令、指挥、要求之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to use your position of authority to say to sb that they must do sth.
order
to use your position of authority to tell sb to do sth

data.chText: 公司被勒令向以前的员工作出补偿。
data.enText: The company was ordered to pay compensation to its former employee.
‘Come here at once!’ she ordered.
tell
to say to sb that they must or should do sth
He was told to sit down and wait.
Don't tell me what to do!
instruct

data.chText: 尤指以正式或官方的方式指示、命令、吩咐：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to tell sb to do sth, especially in a formal or official way

data.chText: 那封信指示他立即向总部汇报。
data.enText: The letter instructed him to report to headquarters immediately.
direct
( formal ) to give an official order

data.chText: 法官指示陪审团作出无罪裁决。
data.enText: The judge directed the jury to return a verdict of not guilty.
command
to use your position of authority to tell sb to do sth
He commanded his men to retreat.

data.chText: order较command通用，可用于任何权威人物命令他人做某事，如父母、老师或政府。command的语气稍强于order，可能暗指有人反对这命令，或如果允许的话，有人会反对。command是部队长官发布命令的一般用词，或者用于发布一般没有商量余地的命令。该词不大可能用于父母或老师。
data.enText: Order is a more general word than command and can be used about anyone in a position of authority, such as a parent, teacher or government telling sb to do sth. Command is slightly stronger than order and can suggest that there is some opposition to the order, or would be if opposition were allowed. It is the normal word to use about an army officer giving orders, or in any context where it is normal to give orders without any discussion about them. It is less likely to be used about a parent or teacher.
order or command?
to order/tell/instruct/direct/command sb to do sth
to order/tell/instruct/direct/command sb that…
to order/instruct/direct/command that…
to do sth as ordered/told/instructed/directed/commanded

ex.chText: 他下令对死亡事件进行调查。
ex.enText: He ordered an investigation into the deaths.

ex.chText: 医生嘱咐严格控制饮食。
ex.enText: The doctor ordered a strict diet.

ex.chText: 我们命令敌兵放下武器。
ex.enText: We ordered that the enemy soldiers lay down their arms.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，多指上级、主人等利用权力、权威等发出指令。

ex.enText: Soldiers must act as they are bidden.
I bade them (to) retreat at once.

synonyms.bx: 较正式用词，多指以口头方式直接下达命令，语气弱于 order。

ex.enText: He commanded that the army attack right away.

ex.chText: 将军命令他的部下夺取这座城市。
ex.enText: The general commanded his men to take over the city.
You have no power to command.

ex.chText: 国王下令把她立即处死。
ex.enText: The King commanded that she be executed right away.

synonyms.bx: 尤指军官、国王等正式下令，强调下令者的权威性，要求接受命令者必须服从。

ex.chText: 请在那儿给我预订个座位。
ex.enText: Please reserve me a seat there.

ex.chText: 他已经在那个五星级饭店预订了一个大包间。
ex.enText: He has reserved a big private room in that five-star hotel.

ex.chText: 你最好提前预订火车票。
ex.enText: You'd better reserve the train ticket in advance.

synonyms.bx: 指预订房间、餐馆、机票、火车票等。

ex.chText: 我已经为我们订了两张票。
在春节期间即使提前订票，你也仍可能买不到。
ex.enText: Even if you book/reserve tickets in advance during the Spring Festival, you may still fail to get one.
This flight is always fully booked/reserved.

tips.tip: 列车上给“老弱病残孕”预留座位，只能用 reserve。

ex.chText: 这家工厂订购了一套新设备。
ex.enText: The plant ordered a new set of equipment.

law and order

data.enText: New Zealand is at the top of the pecking order of rugby nations.
in short order
quickly and without trouble
under starter's orders
waiting for a signal to start the race
be a tall order
to be very difficult to do
just what the doctor ordered
exactly what sb wants or needs
order sb about/around
to keep telling sb what to do in a way that is annoying or unpleasant

tr: the act of putting things in a sequential arrangement
example: there were mistakes in the ordering of items on the list

tr: (architecture) one of original three styles of Greek architecture distinguished by the type of column and entablature used or a style developed from the original three by the Romans
a degree in a continuum of size or quantity
example: it was on the order of a mile
an explosion of a low order of magnitude

tr: a commercial document used to request someone to supply something in return for payment and providing specifications and quantities
example: IBM received an order for a hundred computers

tr: a legally binding command or decision entered on the court record (as if issued by a court or judge)
example: a friend in New Mexico said that the order caused no trouble out there

tr: a body of rules followed by an assembly
(often plural) a command given by a superior (e.g., a military or law enforcement officer) that must be obeyed
example: the British ships dropped anchor and waited for orders from London

tr: a request for something to be made, supplied, or served
example: I gave the waiter my order
the company's products were in such demand that they got more orders than their call center could handle

tr: (biology) taxonomic group containing one or more families
a group of person living under a religious rule
example: the order of Saint Benedict

tr: a formal association of people with similar interests
example: he joined a golf club
they formed a small lunch society
men from the fraternal order will staff the soup kitchen today

tr: logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements
example: we shall consider these questions in the inverse order of their presentation

tr: established customary state (especially of society)
example: order ruled in the streets
law and order

tr: a condition of regular or proper arrangement
example: he put his desk in order
the machine is now in working order

tr: place in a certain order
example: order the photos chronologically

tr: bring order to or into
example: Order these files

tr: assign a rank or rating to
example: how would you rank these students?
The restaurant is rated highly in the food guide

tr: arrange thoughts, ideas, temporal events
example: arrange my schedule
set up one's life
I put these memories with those of bygone times

tr: make a request for something
example: Order me some flowers
order a work stoppage

tr: give instructions to or direct somebody to do something with authority
example: I said to him to go home
She ordered him to do the shopping
The mother told the child to get dressed

tr: issue commands or orders for
appoint to a clerical posts
example: he was ordained in the Church

tr: bring into conformity with rules or principles or usage
impose regulations
example: We cannot regulate the way people dress
This town likes to regulate

value.def: If you do something in order to achieve a particular thing or in order that something can happen, you do it because you want to achieve that thing.

example.ex: Most schools are extremely unwilling to cut down on staff in order to cut costs.
example.tran: 大部分学校都很不愿意为减少开支而裁员。

example.ex: ...asking them to risk their lives in order that the rest of us can sleep better.
example.tran: 为了让我们其余这些人能够睡得更安稳而要他们冒生命危险

value.def: If someone must be in a particular situation in order to achieve something they want, they cannot achieve that thing if they are not in that situation.

example.ex: We need to get rid of the idea that we must be liked all the time in order to be worthwhile...
example.tran: 我们必须抛弃那种认为要想活得有价值就得始终取悦他人的想法。

example.ex: They need hostages in order to bargain with the government.
example.tran: 他们要想同政府讨价还价就得有人质。

value.def: If something must happen in order for something else to happen, the second thing cannot happen if the first thing does not happen.

example.ex: In order for their computers to trace a person's records, they need both the name and address of the individual.
example.tran: 在他们的电脑上查询个人记录，需要提供被查询人的姓名和地址。

value.def: If a person in authority orders someone to do something, they tell them to do it.

example.ex: Williams ordered him to leave...
example.tran: 威廉斯命令他离开。

example.ex: He ordered the women out of the car...
example.tran: 他命令这些女人下车。

example.ex: 'Let him go!' he ordered...
example.tran: “让他走！”他命令道。

example.ex: 'Go up to your room. Now,' he ordered him.
example.tran: “上楼回你的房间去。现在就去！”他命令他道。

value.def: If someone in authority orders something, they give instructions that it should be done.

example.ex: The President has ordered a full investigation...
example.tran: 总统已经下令进行全面调查。

example.ex: The radio said that the prime minister had ordered price controls to be introduced...
example.tran: 据电台报道，首相已下令实行价格管制。

example.ex: He ordered that all party property be confiscated...
example.tran: 他指示没收所有党产。

example.ex: The President ordered him moved because of fears that his comrades would try to free him.
example.tran: 由于担心他的同党会设法营救他，总统下令将他转移。

value.def: If someone in authority gives you an order, they tell you to do something.

example.ex: The activists were shot when they refused to obey an order to halt...
example.tran: 这些激进分子因拒不服从停止前进的命令而被击毙。

example.ex: As darkness fell, Clinton gave orders for his men to rest...
example.tran: 夜幕降临，克林顿命令手下休息。

example.ex: I don't take orders from him any more...
example.tran: 我不再听他差遣。

example.ex: He was released on the orders of the President.
example.tran: 遵照总统的指示，他被释放了。

value.def: A court order is a legal instruction stating that something must be done.

example.ex: She has decided not to appeal against a court order banning her from keeping animals...
example.tran: 对于法院禁止她饲养动物的指令，她决定不再上诉。

example.ex: He was placed under a two-year supervision order.
example.tran: 他被处以两年的监管。

value.def: When you order something that you are going to pay for, you ask for it to be brought to you, sent to you, or obtained for you.

example.ex: Atanas ordered a shrimp cocktail and a salad...
example.tran: 阿塔纳斯点了一份鸡尾冷虾和一份色拉。

example.ex: Iris finally ordered coffees for herself and Tania...
example.tran: 艾丽斯最后为自己和塔妮娅点了咖啡。

example.ex: The waitress appeared. 'Are you ready to order?'...
example.tran: 女侍者走上前来，“您准备好点餐了吗？”

example.ex: We ordered him a beer.
example.tran: 我们给他叫了一瓶啤酒。

value.def: An order is a request for something to be brought, made, or obtained for you in return for money.

example.ex: British Rail are going to place an order for a hundred and eighty-eight trains.
example.tran: 英国铁路公司将订购188列火车。

value.def: Someone's order is what they have asked to be brought, made, or obtained for them in return for money.

example.ex: The waiter returned with their order and Graham signed the bill...
example.tran: 侍者把他们点的餐端了过来，格雷厄姆签了单。

example.ex: They can't supply our order.
example.tran: 我们订的货他们无法供应。

value.def: Something that is on order at a shop or factory has been asked for but has not yet been supplied.

example.ex: The airlines still have 2,500 new aeroplanes on order.
example.tran: 这家航空公司尚有2,500架新飞机在订购中。

value.def: If you do something to order, you do it whenever you are asked to do it.

example.ex: She now makes wonderful dried flower arrangements to order...
example.tran: 现在她为顾客定做漂亮的干花插花。

example.ex: Cars are stolen to order for clients.
example.tran: 偷什么样的车买主说了算。

value.def: If you are under orders to do something, you have been told to do it by someone in authority.

example.ex: I am under orders not to discuss his mission or his location with anyone.
example.tran: 遵照命令，我不能与任何人谈论他执行的任务和他所在的地点。

value.def: If a set of things are arranged or done in a particular order, they are arranged or done so one thing follows another, often according to a particular factor such as importance.

example.ex: Write down (in order of priority) the qualities you'd like to have...
example.tran: （按照优先次序）写下你想具有的品质。

example.ex: Music shops should arrange their recordings in simple alphabetical order, rather than by category...
example.tran: 音像店应当按照简单的字母顺序而不是依类别来摆放唱片。

example.ex: List the key headings and sort them into a logical order...
example.tran: 列出关键标题并按逻辑顺序排列。

example.ex: The chairman has rearranged the order of the speakers.
example.tran: 主席重新安排了发言者的顺序。

gramarinfo.label: also <l>a</l> N, usu with supp, oft <l>in/into</l> N

value.def: Order is the situation that exists when everything is in the correct or expected place, or happens at the correct or expected time.

example.ex: The wish to impose order upon confusion is a kind of intellectual instinct...
example.tran: 想在混乱中理出头绪是一种知性本能。

example.ex: Making lists can create order and control.
example.tran: 列表能使一切井然有序、便于管理。

value.def: Order is the situation that exists when people obey the law and do not fight or riot.

example.ex: Troops were sent to the islands to restore order last November...
example.tran: 去年11月，军队被派往这些岛屿以恢复秩序。

example.ex: He has the power to use force to maintain public order.
example.tran: 他掌握着动用武力维持公共治安的权力。

value.def: When people talk about a particular order, they mean the way society is organized at a particular time.

example.ex: The end of the Cold War has produced the prospect of a new world order based on international co-operation...
example.tran: 冷战的结束带来了建立一个以国际合作为基础的世界新秩序的希望。

example.ex: Some feminists sought reforms within the existing social order.
example.tran: 一些女权主义者寻求在现存的社会制度内进行改革。

value.def: The way that something is ordered is the way that it is organized and structured.

example.ex: ...a society which is ordered by hierarchy...
example.tran: 按等级划分的社会

example.ex: We know the French order things differently.
example.tran: 我们知道法国人安排事情的方式与众不同。

example.ex: ...a carefully ordered system in which everyone has his place.
example.tran: 精心设定、大家各司其职的体制

value.def: If you refer to something of a particular order, you mean something of a particular kind.

example.ex: Another unexpected event, though of quite a different order, occurred one evening in 1973...
example.tran: 1973年的一个夜晚，又发生了一件始料未及的事情，不过这两件事完全不同。

example.ex: Our commitment will be of the highest order.
example.tran: 我们一诺千金。

value.def: A religious order is a group of monks or nuns who live according to a particular set of rules.

example.ex: ...the Benedictine order of monks.
example.tran: 本笃会

value.def: People who belong to a particular order have been given a particular honour or rank by the head of their country as a reward for their services or achievements.

example.ex: The highest Order of Knighthood is the Order of the Garter.
example.tran: 最高骑士勋位是嘉德勋位。

value.def: The person in charge of a meeting can say 'Order!' to tell people to stop making a noise.

xrsa.xrsa_see: ordered;law and order;pecking order;point of order

value.def: If you put or keep something in order, you make sure that it is tidy or properly organized.

example.ex: Now he has a chance to put his life back in order...
example.tran: 现在他有了一个让自己的生活重新步入正轨的机会。

example.ex: It was her job to keep the room in order...
example.tran: 保持房间整洁是她的工作。

example.ex: Someone comes in every day to check all is in order.
example.tran: 每天都有人来检查是否一切都井然有序。

value.def: If you think something is in order, you think it should happen or be provided.

example.ex: Reforms are clearly in order...
example.tran: 改革势在必行。

example.ex: It's great to have you back. Congratulations are surely in order!
example.tran: 你回来真是太好了，就等着向你道贺呢！

value.tran: 应当发生（或提供）的；自然的；合宜的

value.def: You use in the order of or of the order of when mentioning an approximate figure.

example.ex: They borrowed something in the order of £10 million...
example.tran: 他们借了大约1,000万英镑。

example.ex: At other times the discrepancy was of the order of 20%.
example.tran: 往常的出入约为20%。

value.def: If something is in good order, it is in good condition.

example.ex: The vessel's safety equipment was not in good order.
example.tran: 这艘船的安全设备破损失修。

value.def: A machine or device that is in working order is functioning properly and is not broken.

example.ex: Only half of the spacecraft's six science instruments are still in working order.
example.tran: 这艘宇宙飞船的6件科学仪器中只有一半还在正常运转。

value.tran: （机器、设备等）处于正常工作状态

value.def: If a particular way of behaving or doing something is the order of the day, it is very common.

example.ex: These are strange times in which we live, and strange arrangements appear to be the order of the day.
example.tran: 我们生活在这个光怪陆离的时代，各种奇怪的生活安排如今都司空见惯。

value.tran: 时下常见的；普遍的；流行的

value.def: A machine or device that is out of order is broken and does not work.

example.ex: Their phone's out of order.
example.tran: 他们的电话坏了。

value.def: If you say that someone or their behaviour is out of order, you mean that their behaviour is unacceptable or unfair.

example.ex: You don't think the paper's a bit out of order in publishing it?
example.tran: 你不觉得这份报纸发表这篇文章有点不妥吗？

value.tran: 令人无法接受的；不得体的；不公平的

partsOfSpeech.dec: co 共同 + ordin 命令；秩序 + ate 做，造成，使… →〔使〕秩序一样 → 协作
dis 不 + order 命令；秩序 → 混乱；骚乱
in 无 + ordin 命令；秩序 + ate 具有…的，有…性质的 → 无秩序的 → 过度的
in 不 + subordinate 服从的 → 不服从的
ordin 命令；秩序 + al …的 → 有秩序的 → 顺序的
ordin 命令；秩序 + ance 表性质 → 命令 → 法令
ordin 命令；秩序 + ary …的 → 按秩序办的 → 普通的
extra 超 + ordinary 普通的 → 特别的
sub 下级 + ordin 命令；秩序 + ate 表名词 → 顺序在下级 → 下属
